Dave holds a B.A. degree from Haverford College and M.S. and Ph.D. degrees from
Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. He teaches a wide range of computer science
courses and has particular teaching and research interests related to Human
Computer Interaction and pen-based computing.  Dave also teaches
interdisciplinary courses related to design.  He holds three United States
Patents and is the originator of a pen-based instructional technology software
system that is the basis of the commercial system now known as DyKnow.
